summary:
As a BSc in Game Design and Production and director of my own game development company (Twirlbound), my life is about game design and development for the larger part. At a young age I was able to forge a hobby into work, which pays off by loving every single minute of what I do.

I enjoy being involved in game projects on all levels, using my skills in overseeing processes and creatively directing teams to make quality products that resonate with the right audiences. I believe psychology is an invaluable part of game design and design in general, and I always strive to dive deep into the thoughts of people throughout an experience.

awards: [{'title': 'Best Student Technical Achievement', 'description': 'For a school project titled Reivor, I joined a team of 19 people in receiving a Dutch Game Award for best technical achievement. Using an intricate rendering system, the game brings high-quality 2D renders to a 3D digital space for characters to walk around in.', 'issuer': 'Dutch Game Awards', 'date': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, {'title': 'KNAW Onderwijsprijs - Voorselectie Economie & Maatschappij', 'description': 'At the end of secondary school in The Netherlands, a "profielwerkstuk" is crafted: an (academic) piece that fits completely with the chosen direction (in my case Economics & Society). Our project, titled Research into The Prosperity of Nations, made it into the preselection of 2012\'s best projects in the nation. We made it into a book and printed it before submission. The result was a 308-page research into the foundation, rise and fall of nations, the ideal state and what state in the current world comes closest to an ideal state.', 'issuer': 'Koninklijke Nederlandse Akademie van Wetenschappen', 'date': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}]

projects:
[{'title': 'Hexagoal', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Developed during the Brains Eden 2015 gaming festival in Cambridge, this fast-paced arcade game was built around the theme of "Displacement"​. Two players have control over a hexagonal grid which can be displaced by flipping buttons up or down, exempting force on a ball in the field. They try to score in the other player's goal by defending their own and displacing the ball through the field.

The game was shortlisted for an award and received much praise from industry professionals.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Matthijs', 'last_name': 'Van De Laar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Creative Director at Twirlbound'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Timo', 'last_name': 'van Hugten', 'name': None, 'headline': '3D Artist bij Twirlbound'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Martin', 'last_name': 'Stuurwold', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Programmer'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Bert Ruiter', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marc', 'last_name': 'Peyré', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Game Programmer at Twirlbound'}]}, {'title': 'Switch Up!', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'A Global Game Jam 2015 entry around the theme of "What do we do now?", in which four players battle in a side-scrolling shooter using a specific weapon. Every 45 seconds, the rules of the game change: will it be 2v2, free for all or even 1v3? What weapon do you score points with? 

The game reached fourth place on the NHTV Breda location of the worldwide gamejam.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Matthijs', 'last_name': 'Van De Laar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Creative Director at Twirlbound'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ilia', 'last_name': 'Tonev', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Lead Designer at Twirlbound'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Martin', 'last_name': 'Stuurwold', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Programmer'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Timo', 'last_name': 'van Hugten', 'name': None, 'headline': '3D Artist bij Twirlbound'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Bert', 'last_name': 'Ruiter', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Environment Artist at Hangar 13'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marc', 'last_name': 'Peyré', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Game Programmer at Twirlbound'}]}, {'title': 'QuickHunt', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Made for the Ludum Dare 27 gamejam, QuickHunt is an exciting and quick arcade game surrounding the jam's "10 seconds" theme. Players play as the fastest hunter alive, who only needs 10 seconds to hit his animal targets who crawl around his wood cabin.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Matthijs', 'last_name': 'Van De Laar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Creative Director at Twirlbound'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Timo', 'last_name': 'van Hugten', 'name': None, 'headline': '3D Artist bij Twirlbound'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marc', 'last_name': 'Peyré', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Game Programmer at Twirlbound'}]}, {'title': 'Pine', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'An open-world action adventure game set in a simulated world in which humans never reached the top of the food chain.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Matthijs', 'last_name': 'Van De Laar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Creative Director at Twirlbound'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marc', 'last_name': 'Peyré', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Game Programmer at Twirlbound'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Timo', 'last_name': 'van Hugten', 'name': None, 'headline': '3D Artist bij Twirlbound'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Martin', 'last_name': 'Stuurwold', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Programmer'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Pascal', 'last_name': 'Vis', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Lead Character Artist at Twirlbound.'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lukas', 'last_name': 'Stolp', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Animation and Cinematics at Twirlbound'}]}, {'title': 'With the Wind', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'The gusty puzzler with a fresh breeze of Greek mythology! 

Use your powers of the wind to move blocks and gather bags of wind for your father, Aeolus. In over 90 puzzles, players are challenged by spatial problems featuring holes, hatches, tricks and switches.

The game was featured on iOS under Best New Games on May 14 for a full week in a.o. the US App Store.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Matthijs', 'last_name': 'Van De Laar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Creative Director at Twirlbound'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Timo', 'last_name': 'van Hugten', 'name': None, 'headline': '3D Artist bij Twirlbound'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marc', 'last_name': 'Peyré', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Game Programmer at Twirlbound'}]}]
